data.title: Lunch
data.text:
We've gone here several times and each time with hope service + quality improves. 

Pizza-by-the-slice not a good choice. It looks yummy but tastes like flavored cardboard.

Heaven forbid you order from menu (unless you have a lot of spare time).

Salads usually taste good but takes too long to get a carry out order (even if ordered in advance) or be served in restaurant.

We do our best to patronize local businesses and give them benefit of the doubt. 

In our opinion, the quality of food is not worth the wait.

data.title: Great calzones!
data.text: This place can be a little slow when they get busy during events (Alive After 5, Riversedge concerts, etc) but the food is good! It's cheap, limited menu, nothing fancy, but yummy! I always get the calzone with sausage, pepperoni and green pepper. The house salad is also good!

data.title: Dirty place
data.text: There were four of us and decided to give this place a try.  The first thing I noticed was the place was unorganized and dirty.   We all ordered calzones , very doughy and the couple with us found a hair in their food.   When we got our drinks the glasses had scum on them also.

data.title: I would title this the good , the bad, the ugly but there wasn't any good at all!
data.text:
The place only had 3 other people eating at the time we were there.  
We placed our order which took over 20 minutes to receive.  While waiting we saw 2 roaches on the wall.    We told the waitress whom I assumed was the owner and she just acted like it wasn't a big deal.  My daughter refused to even try the food , I took a bite and it was greasy.  We ask for our check and that took her 15 minutes to get that to us.   She ask us if everything was alright and my daughter told her she refused to eat food that had cockroaches in the place.   The owner didn't even offer to make things right.  STAY away from this nasty dirty place!

data.title: Great little place for some great food.
data.text: Love the calzones and the salads.  Everything else is really good too but we all have favorites. Don't pass this hidden gem when in town or watching show at the Riversedge. Prices are really good and all end in 8's.

data.title: Great food and service
data.text: We had a business lunch there a few days ago.  Food had great flavor.  Orders were dead on, and service was friendly.  Prices are reasonable as well.  The Italiano sub is a must try.

data.title: Good value for good food
data.text: Visited during Alive After Five with friends.  Tables were being cleaned for new customers, we only waited a few minutes and all the tables were full.  Some of the kids working seem a little young but they did a pretty good job.  The staff also dressed for the theme night.  Really good steak sandwich and pizza.  Will revisit for sure.  Only negative is the way they write up their tickets and make the customer split them out at the register.  Each family should have their own ticket delivered to their table.  Love that our little town is coming alive again with new small businesses!
